intro: Viola canina nothosubsp. einseleana, commonly known as the Alpine violet, is a rare and hybrid plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. The flowers are typically violet or purple, with five petals and a distinctive spur. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
